text: Timothy D. Barrett is an American papermaker, and director of the Center for the Book, at the University of Iowa, from 1996 to 2002.http://www.bookartspress.com/2007/faculty/barrett_timothy/ He remains on the staff of the Center for the Book, and in 2009 received a MacArthur Foundation grant. He graduated from Antioch College with a BA degree in Art Communications in 1973. ==Awards== * 2009 MacArthur Fellows Program http://www.macfound.org/site/c.lkLXJ8MQKrH/b.5458003/k.9768/Timothy_Barrett.htm ==Works== *Early European papers/contemporary conservation papers: a report on research undertaken from fall 1984 through fall 1987, Institute of Paper Conservation, 1989 *Japanese Papermaking: Traditions, Tools and Techniques, Weatherhill, 1983, *Nagashizuki: the Japanese craft of hand papermaking, North Hills, Pa.: Bird & Bull Press, 1979 http://blogs.princeton.edu/graphicarts/2009/09/congratulations_tim_barrett.html *Paper through Time: Nondestructive Analysis of 14th- through 19th-Century Papers, The University of Iowa, 2012. http://paper.lib.uiowa.edu /index.php ==References== ==External links== Category:Living people Category:Antioch College alumni Category:University of Iowa faculty Category:MacArthur Fellows Category:American book publishers (people) Category:Papermaking in the United States Category:Papermakers Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: Timothy Barrett (papermaker)
